segments.text: welcome back to the soul scene in our
previous list we highlighted 20 of the
best spots to visit in Soul South Korea
and today we're back with another top 10
list packed with new and exciting places
to explore whether you're planning your
first visit or looking to extend your
itinerary these picks will help you
craft an unforgettable Soul Adventure
combine them with our previous list for
the ultimate 10-day trip or mix and
match for a fresh five 5day
[Music]
itinerary hondai is a neighborhood that
is sandwiched between several
universities and is essentially Soul's
playground this area has a very youthful
Vibe and its walkable streets and narrow
Alleyways are full of all different
kinds of
entertainment street performances and
busing are extremely common here as well
as a ton of fun and delicious street
food and snack
vendors H day is also a great place for
shopping and is a particularly great
place for Korean street wear as well as
Denim and vintage clothing it is also a
great place to pick up cute Korean
themed items such as keychains or socks
which also make for great
souvenirs it is pretty much impossible
to get bored in hung day as the area is
also filled with countless arcades
singing rooms stylish and themed cafes
as well as a ton of restaurants and
bars this is also the area where there
are a lot of live music venues and clubs
so it is a great place to go dancing
drinking and to see a concert no matter
what kind of entertainment you are
looking for in Soul you will probably be
able to find it in some capacity in h
[Music]
day the Quang Chong Market is one of
Soul's oldest traditional markets and is
a popular place to taste traditional
Korean flavors rows and rows of vendors
Line This Market offering visitors
delicious homecook style meals and
dishes
from spicy topoki to crispy Korean
pancakes this Market is sure to have
most of the Korean foods you are looking
for the Market's Lively atmosphere will
have you sitting shoulder-to-shoulder
with locals at one of the countless food
stalls or have you exploring the narrow
alley searching through tiny but
delicious restaurants but Quang Chong
Market isn't just about food it's also
home to one of Korea's largest fabric
markets where you can shop for
traditional Korean clothing or unique
handmade souvenirs
for anyone looking for an easy and
convenient way to try out some authentic
Korean foods coffees teas and snacks the
Guang Chong Market is a great location
especially for first-time visitors to
se the war memorial of Korea is a
massive Museum and Memorial honoring
Korea's military history as you arrive
you'll be greeted by towering statues
and monuments symbolizing courage
sacrifice and the Hope For Peace the the
iconic statue of Brothers represents the
heartbreaking division between North and
South Korea inside the museum takes you
on a journey through Korea's military
past from ancient Wars to Modern
conflicts you'll see powerful exhibits
filled with personal letters uniforms
and even real weapons used in battle one
of the highlights of the museum is the
Outdoor exhibition where you can walk
among tanks fighter jets and even a
full-size Battleship it's a rare
opportunity to get up close and personal
to Korea's military history whether
you're a history Enthusiast or just
curious about Korea's past the war
memorial of Korea offers a deeply moving
and educational
experience bansan is a mountain located
in the northern area of seou this
stunning National Park is the perfect
destination for hikers Adventure Seekers
and anyone looking for a break from the
urban Hustle bansan offers a variety of
trails from beginner-friendly walks to
challenging Summit hikes some of the
paths are paved and easily accessible
While others will have you climbing
steep Summits to reach Peaks that offer
stunning views of the city below but
bukhansan isn't just about hiking along
the way you'll discover hidden temples
and fortresses that offer peaceful
places to rest as well as interesting
looks into Korea's history and culture
this beautiful natural land landscape is
one of the most spectacular aspects of
soul and no matter what season you will
be able to enjoy the natural beauty that
bukhansan has to
offer the bomo Han River Park is one of
the best spots in Soul to relax unwind
and enjoy the beauty of the Han River
whether you're here for a picnic a bike
ride or the famous bomo rainbow fountain
show this park has something for
everyone one of the best ways to
experience the park is to grab some
fried chicken and beer or instant Ramen
from a convenience store and have a
picnic by the river it's a favorite
local past time especially during summer
for those looking to stay active the
park offers bike rentals and jogging
trails making it a great place to
explore Soul's natural beauty at your
own pace as the sun sets get ready for
the highlight of the park the bomo
bridge rainbow fountain show this
dazzling display of dancing water
colorful lights and music music happens
nightly from Spring to Fall this park
also offers many festivals and outdoor
markets that is perfect for trying
unique foods and finding unique
souvenirs by local
artists Mong dong is a district that
caters heavily to tourists but that's
really not such a bad thing for visitors
to Soul it is a set of busy streets that
are heavily focused on shopping from May
Major Brands focusing on clothing as
well as Korean beauty products yongdong
pretty much has any kind of store you
could need there is also a big presence
here for K-pop items in shopping
additionally yongdong is famous for its
countless variety of street food which
is not necessarily focused on giving an
authentic Korean food experience but
instead offers a lot of unique and fun
types of street food if you get tired of
all the excitement then you can take a
moment to visit the much more peace
yongdong Cathedral a Gothic style
Catholic Church that is another famous
landmark within the city overall this
area is very friendly and convenient for
foreigners who are visiting Seoul and is
also a nice Central area in Soul that
also offers a lot of hotels if you are
looking for a place to stay that is
within walking distance to a lot of the
major destinations in downtown
Soul Sky Park also known as hunel Park
is one of the most breathtaking outdoor
destinations in Seoul located on the
western side of the city this stunning
Hilltop Park offers panoramic views
peaceful nature trails and some of the
best Sunset spots you'll find in Seoul
to reach the top you can climb the 291
step staircase or take an electric
shuttle for an easier ride either way
the view waiting for you is worth it Sky
Park is famous for its silver grass
fields which turn golden in autumn
creating a magical landscape perfect for
photos this park also offers a lot of
specially made photo zones and often
offers various seasonal festivals as
well this park is also famous for its
fields of Pink mly Grass which blooms in
the Autumn season and turns huge areas
of the park completely pink if you are
looking to spend some time outside
during your visit to Seoul then Sky Park
is a great choice especially during the
Autumn season
[Music]
the Liam Samsung Museum of Art is a
world-class Museum that is a must visit
for art lovers design enthusiasts and
culture Seekers alike the museum itself
is an architectural Beauty each building
reflects a different artistic Vision
blending Korean Heritage with
contemporary
Aesthetics inside the museum is divided
into two main sections Museum 1
showcases traditional Korean art
including ancient Pottery intricate
Buddhist sculptures and historic
calligraphy offering a glimpse into
Korea's Rich cultural past Museum 2 is
dedicated to Modern and Contemporary Art
featuring works by both Korean and
international
artists with its stunning exhibitions
and immersive atmosphere the Liam
Samsung Museum is more than just a
museum it's an experience in blending
the past with the present through
beautiful design
inwangsan is another Mountain that is
located in soou but unlike bukhansan it
is conveniently located in the city
center this is a popular place for more
casual hiking and at 338 M high
inwangsan is a moderate hike that takes
about an hour and a half to 2 hours
round trip the trail follows the soul
Fortress wall a centuries old structure
that once protected the city along the
way you'll also find inwang Temple which
is a Buddhist temple that features
stunning murals depicting traditional
Artistry of course the peak of the
mountain offers more stunning views of
Soul as you can easily spot major
landmarks such as Namsan Tower and yungb
Palace if you are looking for an easily
accessible hiking spot that also offers
some unique Temple experiences then
inang sun is a great spot to
visit the soul botanic Park is a hidden
Oasis and is a must vis a destination
for nature lovers families and travelers
looking for a peaceful Escape within the
city open in 2019 Soul botanic Park is
the first urban botanic Park in Korea
combining a traditional botanical garden
with a public park it features thousands
of plant species from around the world
and host unique events throughout the
seasons one of the highlights of this
park is the Tropical Greenhouse which is
a stunning Dome filled with Lush
rainforests waterfalls and rare plants
from around the world outside you'll
find walking trails a Scenic Lake and
themed Gardens making it the perfect
spot for a relaxing afternoon or a
picnic with friends this is also a great
destination on days when the weather is
not great for exploring outdoor
activities in Soul and is a place I
particularly love to visit to escape the
cold winter
Blues whether you're shopping in the
busy streets of hondai scale ing the
Steep peaks of bukhansan or taking
pictures in the endless fields of Pink
mly Grass soul is a destination that
never disappoints we just shared another
top 10 list for things to do in Soul but
the fun doesn't stop there as always we
are dedicated to helping you explore all
the wonderful things Soul has to offer
and more so don't forget to like share
and subscribe for more travel guides and
tips if you've got any favorite
destinations in Soul or places you think
we've missed let us know in the comments
below and we'll see you next time here
at the soul scene
